Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored Scotland to win based on their current form.
Pep Guardiola emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession.
The Messi vs. Ronaldo clash was highlighted as the match's main attraction.
Post-Match Reflections: Erik ten Hag praised his team’s resilience after coming back from 2-0 down.
Chelsea’s manager described the win as a crucial step toward securing a top-four finish.
Luka Modric hinted at retiring from international football after the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Heavy rain delayed the match by 30 minutes.
This marked Arsenal’s first league title since 2004.
Others: Gibraltar’s record against Scotland is anything but good, although their first encounter will be remembered long and hard by Gibraltar fans.
It was a moment in which Gibraltar fans for a short period dreamt of possible glories for probably the first time.
Gibraltar will face Wales which has seen its club status drop in recent years and now sitting at the same level as Gibraltar.
Scotland will take on hosts Germany at the Allianz Arena on 14 June where, just like in the 1998 World Cup in France, Scotland will kick off the tournament in the opening match.
